segment.source: Configure a Trusted Image Identifier for Windows Defender
segment.target: Configure a Trusted Image Identifier for Windows Defender

segment.source: Configure a Trusted Image Identifier for Windows Defender
segment.target: Configure a Trusted Image Identifier for Windows Defender

segment.source: Configure a Trusted Image Identifier for Windows Defender
segment.target: Configure a Trusted Image Identifier for Windows Defender

segment.source: You can speed up the initial performance of your computer for the end user by adding a trusted image identifier to Windows® Defender.
segment.target: You can speed up the initial performance of your computer for the end user by adding a trusted image identifier to Windows® Defender.

segment.source: Windows Defender is a Microsoft® application that can help to prevent, remove, and quarantine malware and spyware.
segment.target: Windows Defender is a Microsoft® application that can help to prevent, remove, and quarantine malware and spyware.

segment.source: By default, Windows Defender performs a scan of each file on the computer when the computer accesses the file for the first time.
segment.target: By default, Windows Defender performs a scan of each file on the computer when the computer accesses the file for the first time.

segment.source: This is known as an on-access scan.
segment.target: This is known as an on-access scan.

segment.source: Optimization mechanisms, such as caching, help reduce unnecessary scans of files that have already been scanned.
segment.target: Optimization mechanisms, such as caching, help reduce unnecessary scans of files that have already been scanned.

segment.source: When Windows Defender performs a quick scan or a full scan (also known as on-demand scans), the rest of the files on the system will be marked as safe.
segment.target: When Windows Defender performs a quick scan or a full scan (also known as on-demand scans), the rest of the files on the system will be marked as safe.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you have already deployed a series of computers, and then later determine that there is a potential problem with the security of the image, contact your Depth Project Manager (PM) within the Windows Ecosystem Engagement team.
segment.target: If you have already deployed a series of computers, and then later determine that there is a potential problem with the security of the image, contact your Depth Project Manager (PM) within the Windows Ecosystem Engagement team.

segment.source: and provide the unique identifier of the image.
segment.target: and provide the unique identifier of the image.

segment.source: Microsoft will add this unique identifier into Windows Update.
segment.target: Microsoft will add this unique identifier into Windows Update.

segment.source: After a computer with that unique identifier receives updates from Windows Update, Windows Defender performs scans on all of the files on that computer.
segment.target: After a computer with that unique identifier receives updates from Windows Update, Windows Defender performs scans on all of the files on that computer.

segment.source: Adding a Trusted Image Identifier
segment.target: Adding a Trusted Image Identifier

segment.source: For optimal performance, we recommend that you add this setting when you prepare the computer for final deployment, after you perform a full scan of the final image.
segment.target: For optimal performance, we recommend that you add this setting when you prepare the computer for final deployment, after you perform a full scan of the final image.

segment.source: To add a trusted image identifier
segment.target: To add a trusted image identifier

segment.source: Create an answer file that you are going to use with Sysprep, and add the Security-Malware-Windows-Defender setting.
segment.target: Create an answer file that you are going to use with Sysprep, and add the Security-Malware-Windows-Defender setting.

segment.source: For more information, see Use Answer Files with Sysprep.
segment.target: For more information, see Use Answer Files with Sysprep.

segment.source: For the value of the setting, specify a unique identifier, such as a GUID, for the image.
segment.target: For the value of the setting, specify a unique identifier, such as a GUID, for the image.

segment.source: Install Windows on the reference computer, and perform all updates that are described in the "Common Sysprep Scenarios" section of the Sysprep (System Preparation) Overview topic.
segment.target: Install Windows on the reference computer, and perform all updates that are described in the "Common Sysprep Scenarios" section of the Sysprep (System Preparation) Overview topic.

segment.source: Perform a scan of the image by using Windows Defender or another scanning tool.
segment.target: Perform a scan of the image by using Windows Defender or another scanning tool.

segment.source: This can help make sure that the image is safe.
segment.target: This can help make sure that the image is safe.

segment.source: When you run Sysprep for the final time, use the Sysprep command together with the /oobe and /unattend options, as follows:
segment.target: When you run Sysprep for the final time, use the Sysprep command together with the /oobe and /unattend options, as follows:

segment.source: Perform other offline tasks, such as offline servicing of the image.
segment.target: Perform other offline tasks, such as offline servicing of the image.

segment.source: Capture and apply the image to other computers, and then deliver the computer to the customer.
segment.target: Capture and apply the image to other computers, and then deliver the computer to the customer.

segment.source: The next time that the computer starts, Windows identifies all of the files currently on the system, and skips these files during subsequent scans.
segment.target: The next time that the computer starts, Windows identifies all of the files currently on the system, and skips these files during subsequent scans.
